00021 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00022 #include "util/BaseEngine.h"
00023 #include "util/Engines.h"
00024 #include "util/Fs.h"
00025 #include "util/LogStream.h"
00026 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00027 #include "util/Util.h"
00028 //
00029 #include <cstring>
00030 #include <list>
00031 #include <string>
00032 #include <vector>
00033 
00034 //
00035 #ifndef WIN32
00036 #include <unistd.h>
00037 #endif /* WIN32 */
00038 
00039 
00040 using namespace std;
00041 
00042 /** Everybody's favorite function... */
00043 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00044   ofstream logOut;
00045   LogStream log;
00046   string logName;
00047   bool closeLog = false;
00048     
00049   try {
00050   const string version = AptVersionInfo::version();
00051   const string cvsId = AptVersionInfo::cvsId();
00052   const string versionToReport = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00053     
00054 
00055   /* Parse options. */
00056   PgOptions opts;
00057   opts.setUsage("apt-engine-wrapper - Generic wrapper around the engine\n"
00058                 "factory. You probably want to use one of the engine\n"
00059                 "specific wrappers. Use ' -- ' to separate wrapper args\n"
00060                 "from engine args.\n\n"
00061                 "usage:\n"
00062                 "   apt-engine-wrapper --help \n"
00063                 "   apt-engine-wrapper --engine ProbesetSummarizeEngine --help \n"
00064                 "   apt-engine-wrapper --engine ProbesetSummarizeEngine -- \\\n"
00065                 "     --cdf-file=... \n\n");
00066   opts.defineOption("", "engine", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00067                     "The engine to run.",
00068                     "");
00069   opts.defineOption("", "log-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00070                     "The file to write out log items to.",
00071                     "");
00072   opts.defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00073                     "This message.",
00074                     "false");
00075   opts.defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00076                     "Display version information.",
00077                     "false");
00078   opts.defineOption("", "verbose", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00079                     "Verbosity Level.",
00080                     "1");
00081 
00082   int argvPos = opts.parseArgv(argv);
00083   const string progName = Fs::basename(opts.getProgName());
00084 
00085   // does the user want the version 
00086   if(opts.getBool("version")) {
00087     cout << "version: " << versionToReport << endl;
00088     exit(0);
00089   }
00090   // Do we need help? (I know I do...)
00091   else if(opts.getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00092     opts.usage();
00093 
00094     if(opts.get("engine")!= "") {
00095         BaseEngine *engine = EngineReg::CreateEngine(opts.get("engine"));
00096         if(engine == NULL)
00097             Err::errAbort("Unable to create engine named '"+opts.get("engine")+"'");
00098         engine->optionUsage();
00099     } else {
00100         list<string> engineNames = EngineReg::GetEngineNames();
00101         cout << endl << "Available Engines:" << endl;
00102         for(list<string>::iterator iter = engineNames.begin(); iter != engineNames.end(); iter++) {
00103             cout << "   " << *iter << endl;
00104         }
00105     }
00106     cout << endl << "version: " << versionToReport << endl;
00107     exit(0);
00108   }
00109   else if(opts.get("engine")!= "") {
00110         BaseEngine *engine = EngineReg::CreateEngine(opts.get("engine"));
00111         if(engine == NULL)
00112             Err::errAbort("Unable to create engine named '"+opts.get("engine")+"'");
00113 
00114         /* Set up the logging and message handlers. */
00115         Verbose::setLevel(opts.getInt("verbose"));
00116         if(opts.get("log-file") != "") {
00117             string logName = opts.get("log-file");
00118             Fs::mustOpenToWrite(logOut, logName.c_str());
00119             log.setStream(&logOut);
00120             Verbose::pushMsgHandler(&log);
00121             Verbose::pushProgressHandler(&log);
00122             Verbose::pushWarnHandler(&log);
00123             closeLog = true;
00124         }
00125 
00126         engine->parseArgv(argv,argvPos+1);
00127 
00128         engine->run();
00129   }
00130   } 
00131   catch(...) {
00132       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00133       // Close log files
00134       if(closeLog) {
00135           logOut.close();
00136       }
00137       return 1;
00138   }
00139   // Close log files
00140   if(closeLog) {
00141      logOut.close();
00142   }
00143 
00144   return 0;
00145 }
